page.title: 18Local History In Norton Area
page.content: The Hundred House in Norton used to be a court, and the stocks were used to put people in who had done something wrong. On the side of the stocks there is a whipping post. The pond was used for ducking ladies who nagged men. They used to have a pole with a seat strapped to it, and people came to watch. A person ducked the ladies, and they came out wet, spitting dirty water out of their mouths. Near the stocks there used to be an oak tree, but the roots were growing under the road, so a few years ago they cut it down. The boys from Apley Park School made a seat from the tree stump. The bus shelter in Norton was opened when Queen Elizabeth II was crowned.
